actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 284 (Sen. Gillibrand):
        A resolution expressing support for the designation of June 2023 as "National Dairy Month" to recognize the important role dairy plays in a healthy diet and the exceptional work of dairy producers in being stewards of the land and livestock.

        -- Senate Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 289 (Sen. Feinstein):
        A resolution expressing support for the designation of July 2023 as "American Grown Flower Month".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 290 (Sen. Braun):
        A resolution honoring the life of Oliver Hazard Perry Morton.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN70:
        Rosemarie Hidalgo, of the District of Columbia, to be Director of the Violence Against Women Office, Department of Justice

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 42. Record Vote Number: 175 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 42. Record Vote Number: 177 



 PN81:
        Tiffany M. Cartwright, of Washington, to be United States District Judge for the Western District of Washington

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 42. Record Vote Number: 179 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, vote 7/12/2023.


 PN168:
        Kymberly Kathryn Evanson, of Washington, to be United States District Judge for the Western District of Washington

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 42. Record Vote Number: 176 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 42. Record Vote Number: 178 



 PN382:
        Xochitl Torres Small, of New Mexico, to be Deputy Secretary of Agriculture

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 84 - 8. Record Vote Number: 174
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Schumer, at  7:15 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
